intro: Helicteres cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese helicteres, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, hairy seeds. Helicteres cavaleriei is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
